statements: UPDATE SolarFarmInstallations SET project_name='SolarTech Project', forecasted_revenue=50000.00 WHERE id=1;
UPDATE SolarFarmInstallations SET actual_revenue=35000.00, total_cost=45000.00, developer_id=3 WHERE id=3;
UPDATE SolarFarmInstallations SET actual_revenue = 75000.00, forecasted_revenue = 80000.00 WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE SolarFarmInstallations SET total_cost = 1200000.00, installation_date = '2023-09-15' WHERE developer_id = 5 AND project_name = 'Green Energy Project';
UPDATE solar_projects SET total_cost = 150000.00 , end_date = '2023-12-31' WHERE project_id = 1;
UPDATE financial_forecasts SET revenue = 75000.00 , expenses = 30000.00 , profit = 45000.00 WHERE project_id = 2;
UPDATE solar_projects SET total_cost = 50000, end_date = '2023-12-31' WHERE project_id = 1;
UPDATE financial_forecasts SET revenue = 75000.50, expenses = 30000.25, profit = revenue - expenses WHERE project_id = 2 AND forecast_date = '2023-06-30';
UPDATE solar_farms SET area = 150, capacity = 200 WHERE id = 1
UPDATE forecasts SET energy_output = 300, weather_conditions = 'Sunny' WHERE project_id = 2
UPDATE solar_farms SET area = 50.75, capacity = 100 WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE financial_data SET revenue = 75000, expenses = 50000, profit = 25000 WHERE project_id = 1 AND year = 2022;
UPDATE solar_farms SET capacity = 200 WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE developers SET country = 'USA' WHERE id = 3;
UPDATE solar_farms SET capacity = 100, location = 'California' WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE financial_data SET revenue = 150000, year = 2022 WHERE solar_farm_id = 2;
UPDATE Customers SET email = 'newemail@example.com' WHERE customer_id = 1;
UPDATE Financials SET net_income = 5000.75 WHERE financial_id = 2;
UPDATE Projects SET location = 'New Location', start_date = '2022-09-01' WHERE project_id = 101;
UPDATE Solar_Panels SET efficiency = 17.5, purchase_date = '2022-08-15' WHERE panel_id = 201;
